results.description:
A Course in Miracles Group Tuesdays from 7:00 to 8:30 PM The serene and peaceful waterside setting of Wainwright House provides a wonderful environment to study the Course. A Course in Miracles is a complete self-study spiritual thought system based on universal spiritual themes. Our group meets to read and discuss the principles that make up the Daily Lessons, the Text, and the Manual for Teachers. For the purpose of shared reading, we recommend that members bring the book titled, A Course in Miracles, Published by the Foundation for Inner Peace, Combined Volume.

 The Course does not aim at teaching the meaning of love, for that is beyond what can be taught. It does aim, however, at removing the blocks to the awareness of love's presence, which is your natural inheritance. This course can therefore be summed up very simply in this way: Nothing real can be threatened. Nothing unreal exists. Herein lies the peace of God.

 All are welcome to join us in this gentle and relaxed setting of learners.$5 donation for room. For more information, please contact acimgroup@yahoo.com Wainwright House is located at 260 Stuyvesant Ave, Rye NY (914)967-6080
results.name: A Course in Miracles at Wainwright House, Rye NY

results.description:
Are you thinking about jumping into the hottest real estate market?  Our home buyer workshops will cover key questions prospective homebuyers should ask as they prepare to make the largest financial purchase of their lives. We outline the steps to buying a home in New York City and provide practical and informative advice from industry insiders and veterans. 
 
Topics covered in our workshops include:
* How much money do I need to buy a home in NYC?
* Mortgage payment versus rent - similarities/differences; pros/cons
* Bank criteria for loan applicants
* Down payment assistance (for eligible purchasers)
* What does a [real estate agent/ real estate attorney/ mortgage banker] do for me?  
* Insider knowledge on how to pick the best agent/ attorney and mortgage professional
* Pros and cons of purchasing different types of homes
* Condominiums vs Cooperatives; the differences, formation, governance, common charges etc.
* An overview of terminology  homebuyers will hear during the home buying process
* Post Closing-after you own, what to be careful with once you own the home including rental collection, being a landlord, maintenance

You can't afford not to attend our meet-ups!!!!
results.name: Insider Tips for New York Real Estate Home Buyers

results.description: The Universal Negro Improvement Association & African Communities’ League is a social, friendly, humanitarian, charitable, educational, institutional, constructive, spiritually governing ruling body, and is founded by persons, desiring to the utmost, to work for the general uplift of the Negro peoples of the world. And the members pledge themselves to do all in their power to conserve the rights of their noble race and to respect the rights of all mankind, believing always in the Brotherhood of Man and the Fatherhood of God. MISSION STATEMENT The Universal Negro Improvement Association and African Communities League is a provisional government lead by a spiritual ruling governing body that is established for the purpose of the general uplift of the Black race. In keeping with this purpose our goals involve activities aimed at relieving the sufferings of the Black race and include the following: - Education and Training - Nutrition and Healthcare - Housing - Arts and Humanities - Agronomy and Applied Sciences - Building and Trades - Manufacturing - Economic Development The motto of the organization is: “One God! One Aim! One Destiny!” Therefore, let justice be done to all mankind, realizing that if the strong oppresses the weak confusion and discontent will ever mark the path of man, but with love, faith and charity towards all the reign of peace and plenty will be herded into the world and the generations of men shall be called blessed.

results.description:
Are you a women, age 50 or over, with a sense of adventure and a “bucket list” of things you’d like to experience? 

Do you have a desire to connect and make new friends with like minded women our age?

Are you looking for a place to share good times doing the things you’ve always loved?

If so, you’ve come to the right place!  Baby Boomer Women Social is a group designed to foster lasting friendships among vibrant, spirited women who have a desire to partcipate in a wide range of activities that pique our interests, expand our horizons, rejuvenate our minds and bodies, and unleash our passions. 

• Discover your "inner artist" at an Art and Wine Party …

• Escape for a weekend “self-renewal” retreat  …

• Bring out your "zany side" during an afternoon of improv …

• Enjoy dinner and the theater or a lively game of BUNCO over drinks and hors d’eourves …

• Spend a rejuvenating day at the spa … 

• Learn what it’s like to dance like a Rockette … 

• Try something a little more daring like parasailing (or cheer the group on from a seat in the boat) … 

• Share your passion for Impressionism during a trip to the art museum or your love of Puccini during a night at the opera ... 

• Join us in an activity that sparks your imagination or just sounds like fun!

In the words of Eleanor Roosevelt, “The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” 

PLEASE NOTE: Baby Boomer Women Social is a friendly, supportive, fun-loving group of women that has traditionally had an "open door" policy when it comes to membership. Unfortunately, this policy was abused by some unscrupulous individuals.  We were able to obtain sufficient information to allow Meetup to identify those individuals and ban them from the site.  However, after careful consideration and at the suggestion of Meetup's Trust and Safety Team, new policies have been implemented in an effort to protect the privacy and security of our members from unwelcome and inappropriate solicitation going forward to the extent that it is possible on the Internet, and in an effort to allow all members of our group to socialize and communicate freely with one another without fear of harassment.  To that end, effective June 16, 2015, women who are interested in joining our group must first request to become a member and be approved before gaining access to our site. When you request to become a member of Baby Boomer Women Social, you will simply be asked to answer a few brief questions and upload an appropriate photo of yourself. Photos of animals, flowers, signs, "stock photos", portions of your body (i.e., your eye) or photos that are decades old, mask your face and/or make it impossible to identify you are not considered appropriate. Regretfully, any request that fails to provide appropriate answers and an appropriate photo will be denied. 

     This is by no means an indication that Baby Boomer Women Social is a "cliquish" group. Indeed, we welcome new members and we hope that these new policies will not deter you from joining us!
results.name: Baby Boomer Women Social: To Enrich the Midlife Journey

results.description: The “INSIGHT CAFE” is a safe, fun, social conversation group where members gather to explore and discuss thought-provoking topics such as “What IS our purpose in life?” or “The meaning of MY existence”. While ideas and viewpoints from fields that include psychology, philosophy, sociology, religion, science - even the metaphysical, are open to discussion, no formal or specialized knowledge is required to participate. All that's requested is that you have a sense of curiosity, be open-minded, and respectful of other members' opinions and feelings. Meetings will include: open discussions, informative multi-media presentations, special guest speakers, and “Q and A” sessions on related topics and issues. Attendees will also discover “sources for resources” which they can review, with the opportunity to purchase, materials or services they deem interesting, entertaining, or beneficial. The Pleasure Salon was founded in 2007 to build community, allowing sex-positive people to cross-pollinate. Our gatherings bring together members of the BDSM, swinger, alternative gender, LGBTQ, sex educator, nudist, sex-magic, polyamory, Pagan, radical faerie, tantra, sex-blogger, porn, pervert and sex-worker communities, and others whose passion is sex. Join us in building New York's pleasure positive community, and bring your like-minded friends to this meet and greet. Let's make in-person social networking for fun, affordable activities in our neighborhood a priority! Love board games/strategy games/word games/card games? Seek puzzles and other mental challenges? results.description: This groups mission is to meet the group-running needs of those who do not work normal 9-5 hours and still want to participate in the enormous New York group running culture. I began marathon running in 2010 and consider running a bit of an obsession. After starting a job in management consulting, I found it difficult to consistently attend any existing running group sessions, as most did not accommodate my unique working hours. I tend to hit the pavement by 6am for morning runs, an after 8pm for post-work runs. I also live and work in the financial district, and have found few groups who meet in my neighborhood. This group will meet rather early or late, depending on the day, for group runs at moderate (weekend warrior) pace runs. We will run primarily out-and-back and loop runs that start and end in the financial district, and can be more creative on weekend runs. The goal is to accommodate athletes who work abnormal hours and provide the valuable benefits of a running community for those with even the most demanding work schedule.

results.description:
Welcome to the Drunk History Book Club!  Each month we select a different title and get together for an informal discussion.

The Books

We rotate through three types of history:

• Near: NYC history

• Far: US history

• Really far: anywhere outside the US

Towards the end of each meetup we select the title or subject for next month.  Check out the About page for ideas.

The Venues

Bars, obviously.  We try to pick venues related to the current book selection (themes, neighborhoods, etc.).  We prefer places that are close to a major subway line and are cool with people who may not want to drink.

The Group

All are welcome.  We love different backgrounds, points of view, and takes on history.  Even if you didn’t finish the book -- some of the selections can be long and dry and we completely understand if you can’t get through it in a month.  Our only rules: respect the opinions of others and respect the booze.

results.description:
Welcome to Tinkergarten Manhattan! 

Do you wonder if the unbridled, outdoor play that used to be part of the fabric of growing up has been lost? At Tinkergarten, we know that is where true learning happens, so we’re here to bring it back!

As a member of this group, you'll be invited to join us for free trial classes and special events in Central Park, and other parts of the city. You'll meet other parents who believe in learning through play and outdoor adventure. We'll also share outdoor DIY activity ideas, and let you know about new classes  starting in your area.

Those who have been members for a while will note that we began as Tinkergarten Central Park - UWS & UES.  We intended to use the group to share outdoor DIY activity ideas, and inform people about upcoming classes, including free events in Central Park for UWS and UES families (and those willing to travel). 

The good news? We're going to keep doing all of that -- we're just expanding our reach so we can share Tinkergarten with more kids and families, in more parts of the city we love.

We'd love you to join our community. Then, take your kids outside and play!

To get ideas for fun outdoor activities: http://www.tinkergarten.com

If you're interested in leading classes at your community: http://tinkergarten.com/leader/

To get in touch, email kate@tinkergarten.com

results.description:
Anyone who follows the daily happenings of technology knows that it’s fascinating and debate inducing. The constant headlines of change and disruption is enough to leave anyone with more questions than answers.

While its natural to internalize and apply ones thinking to his/her own interests, experts agree that it's also important to understand a view that is larger than that which transcends our own interests. The Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp is an event where we encourage a community of entrepreneurs, investors and professional service providers, among others, in New York City to learn, think about and have dialogue on technology’s future impact on society. How will driverless cars affect the insurance industry? Is space exploration a needed component to our nations future? Is there such thing as privacy?

In order to reach an understanding, the Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp invites our country’s foremost experts to tackle these topics. But we also need YOU, to bring your background and point of view. This MeetUp is not meant to answer all the questions and solidify the solutions, rather its purpose is to foster the conversations and facilitate discussions around the topics.

If you're an entrepreneur, tech professional, or anyone genuinely interested how technology will affect society, this MeetUp is an opportunity to listen and learn, exchange ideas and network with liked-minded individuals.

We hope you will join us. Stay tuned for our first monthly meetup happening soon!
results.name: Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp

results.description: Hi everyone! I'm Francesca - a 45 year old mom living in Maplewood. As a plus-sized woman, it's harder for me to find a network of like-minded women who come across the same challenges as I do in life... everything from shopping for clothes, to fitting in movie theater seats, to exercise. Resources for larger women are slim to none (pun intended!). Therefore, I want to create a network of plus sized women that are a RESOURCE FOR EACH OTHER. I want to build strong friendships, have fun with people who feel comfortable around each other, and provide an ample shoulder to lean on when times get tough. THIS GROUP IS NOT FOR BBW ADMIRERS!! This group is for plus sized women who want to do the following with each other: - shopping... at stores where clothes fit us! - fun outings... where the activity level fits our needs and abilities! - movies... with people who understand that we need a seat in between each other, and don't feel weird about it! - dinner out... without anyone looking at your plate and wondering if you should "really be eating that!" - fitness...without judgement, at a pace and level that works for each person! - FEEL FREE TO BE 100% WHO WE ARE AROUND EACH OTHER! I live in Maplewood but work in Piscataway, so meet ups will be in central & Northern NJ, as well as NYC, which I LOVE! Looking forward to meet you!

results.description:
(Please read the description below completely . Thanks) 

We're a diverse group of women of all backgrounds, races, and walks of life, who just so happen to feel more comfortable in the “cool” crowd... if you know what I mean.

I plan on keeping this group uber small, and the events even smaller, so to improve your chances of acceptance, show us your personality by answering all profile questions to the best of your ability, and by including a clear photo of yourself.

Don't let the title fool you in to thinking we're not about making bona fide friendships; hopefully friendships that go way beyond meetup.

Requirements

• Must be attractive - I'm obviously not talking super model gorgeous here. I just mean cute and well put together. Don't be intimated to join. This is a sisterhood!

• Must upload clear, close, and recent photo of yourself as well as answer all questions.  (No pics of babbling brooks or rolling hills, although, I'm a sucker for pretty landscapes.)

• Must be between the ages of 21-35ish :)

• Must be fun and outgoing. (Sorry, No wallflowers). Only POSITIVE, upbeat personalities please.

• Must be sweet, caring, and willing to form genuine friendships.

• Must not be socially awkward in a group setting. 

• Must not be self-absorbed, rude or anything else in that vein. This isn't a group for mean girls, just a group of women who truly want to form genuine relationships, whether we're hitting a club, picnicking in the park, or hanging out at one another's apartments.

• MUST BE AN ACTIVE MEMBER. The point is to actually see you. This is a small group, so inactive members will be deleted after TWO Months.

Let's just have fun in the city! Please Join.

results.description:
Visit us on FaceBook!!  - facebook.com/NJTeamDragons


Dragon Boat is a fast growing, international team sport which offers a full-body workout, competitive spirit, and a summer tan. 

Team Dragons invites all ACTIVE Guys, Women, and Teens (16+ & up).  No paddling experience is necessary to try AND LOVE this exciting, adrenaline pumping sport! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cqqQGRZHZ2k

A dragon boat is basically a long canoe with a dragon head in the front and tail in the back. The crew consists of 20 paddlers - 10 on the left, 10 on the right, 1 drummer in the front of the boat, and 1 steersman in the back.  Most races are 200m, 500m, 1000m, or 2000 meters long.  When you have 20 people paddle in synch, the boat can move as fast as 15 MPH!


The NJ Dragon Boat Club consists of 3 types of crews to choose from:

• Team Dragons, a mixed crew competitive Racing team

• Mixed recreational team

• Team SOS Pathways, an all women breast cancer survivor team


We supply all the equipment and training. Our season starts on water from April and ends around October and usually practice 2 to 3 times a week.   This is GREAT for those weekend warriors as well!

We know everybody has a busy life, so practice is not mandatory unless you sign up for the Dragon Boat Races. We usually plan for 4 Races every season. Last year, we competed in Baltimore MD, Princeton NJ, Hartford CT and Montreal Canada with medals and trophies as return for all the hard work you commit and put in.

If you are looking for exercise and want to meet new people in a co-ed team sport environment (recreational or competitive), contact New Jersey Dragon Boat Club for more information.  Our members are from 14 years old to 65 years old.

 For more information go to facebook.com/NJTeamDragons and njdragonboat.org

Contact Team Managers Alain and Don at njteamdragons@gmail.com for more details.


Please complete and bring this WAIVER (linked) for each individual.

See ya'll dockside!

The blessing is a brief, light laying on of hands of subtle energies transmitted by Oneness Blessing Givers that initiate a neurophysical change in the brain, declutching the mind and quieting inner chatter and divisiveness. Participants experience deep inner peace and expansiveness during the process, resulting in growing clarity, inner peace, self-acceptance, personal breakthroughs, and miracles. 

The evening includes a chakra meditation to raise kundalini (energy) and a discussion or Q&A period. During the blessing, you just sit in a chair with your eyes closed, listen to beautiful music, and receive multiple transmissions of grace. results.description:
Welcome to the group, Reel Shooters! I'm looking for members who are hungry to be successful in the entertainment industry. All actors and crew members, whether motivated newbies or experienced talent, are welcomed to join.

My experience, with several film meetup groups, is that everyone is overly-ambitious at the inception. Many times, the group attempts to complete only one project (successfully or unsuccessfully), then everyone disappears into oblivion. Many actors stray away to other projects, hoping it could be their big break. Projects crumble. There is no business savvy to take a completed project to the next level. Etc Etc. Hopefully, this group will be different from the norm.

My intention is to propel this group towards the online media platform. I personally don't want this group to be working for free all the time, grovelling for attention at mediocre film festivals, begging for money on Kickstarter or IndieGogo or be a total waste of time, effort and labor. Creating content online is the only smart way for independent filmmakers to fully explore their creativity, maintain ownership, become recognized for their hard work and generate revenue for their projects, without experiencing the hassles of the industry. The big guys come to you after. I know this because I've seen this happen thousands of times with online talent. Simply because, these guys are perfecting their own talent and individual brand, and not grovelling to please anyone. 

Personally, I'm a highly efficient, determined and organized individual. Within 7 months, I've already worked on a national Dunkin Donuts commercial, worked with the brilliant veteran actress Judith Roberts, became a verified YouTube Partner and have 10 episodes in Post Production of my first web series, whilst juggling my day job and social life. If you think the same and don't make excuses, not only will we get along great, but we will be closer to "REEL" success!

In this group, you will have an opportunity to collaborate with each other. I, also, have several projects in the pipeline, so there will always be something to work on. Everyone will be properly credited on IMDB as well.

Here are a list of issues that will get you banned from the group:

-If there is any form of member harassment, you will be banned.

-If you flake without reason, you will be banned.

-If you never contribute to the group, you will be banned. I'm very meticulous about people lurking around with the possible intention of taking our ideas. Even if you can't attend production meetings or the actual shoot, contributions can range from feedback, constructive criticism, editing, scoring, designing posters etc.

-If you don't answer the intro questions, you will be denied entry into the group.


Anyways, that's enough of me blabbering for now. Thanks, and welcome to the group!

-Nash.

(Director, Writer, Motion Graphics Designer)
results.name: REEL Shooters

results.description:
This is the official meetup page of Bubble Soccer NYC (http://www.bubbleballsoccernyc.com)

More fun than soccer, safer than football, cheaper than hockey, and bouncier than basketball. BubbleBall guarantees to make you spin, bounce and laugh like no other sport in history! 


What is Bubble Ball Soccer?

Bubble soccer (also known as “Boblefotball” "bubble football" "bumperz" and "bubble ball") is the brainchild of Henrik Elvestad and Johan Goldenfirst. The first game appeared on Golden Goal, a Norwegian TV show, in 2011. Since then it has rapidly spread like wildfire throughout the world and finally, Bubble Ball Soccer has landed in NYC (the tri-state area). 

To play, teams of up to ten players don typical soccer/sports clothing and put their giant bubble ball suits (loosely described as giant, inflatable hamster balls) on top. Each suit is very safe and is designed for any type of weather or outdoor arena.They have a built in backpack style harness so you can strap the balls on, and handles to allow for pain free spills, hard tackling, bumping, knocking, bouncing and rolling.

Don't worry though, you won't get a yellow card for this type of behavior. Bubble ball soccer is a full contact sport and there are no tackling fouls to be heard of. Roughhousing is actually encouraged and what makes bubble ball soccer so much fun! The balls will absorb the tackle and do what it does best, bounce back and bring you to your feet without causing you any harm, pain or injury!

So, what are the actual rules? Simple - keep the balls in bounds and score! This is a lot harder than it looks (actually it doesn't look easy at all) and as a result most games end up with only a few goals. Despite this fact, it's still a very entertaining game to watch and even more fun to play. Expect to burn up to 1000 calories, sweat, laugh, get some aggression out and experience withdrawal symptoms until your next round!
results.name: NYC Bubble Ball

results.description:
Ever wanted to be a full stack developer? We here at developer unicorns will teach you the ins and outs of full stack awesomeness. Learn - python, javascript, ruby, mobile development, hardware hacking and more!


* Who should join: 

We have three types of members: 

1)   Those trying to learn to code. 

2)  Those strong in one area (like frontend development) but looking to grow in other areas

3)  Those already strong in general (like an average full stack developer) but looking to stay current with tools in the field

  
* Why should members join: 

The central goal of Developer Unicorns is to create a group of people who keep each other abreast of the most current technologies in the world of mobile and web development.  This includes front end, backend, big data, and industry specific knowledge.  

Members should join if they want to meet other folks trying to learn more about software development, if they want to make new friends in the tech space, or if they just love learning about current technology.


* What can members expect out of the group: 

There are two types of events that our community holds regularly - lecture style talks and workshop style events.

During the lecture style talks a topic is introduced and a lecture is given.  This covers a high level overview of the topic and shows you some examples of how to use the technology being discussed.  This could be a technology stack, a design pattern, a new language, a framework, or a new piece of hardware, etc.  

During the workshop style event members are given the option to work on discrete exercises or hack on their own project using the topic discussed during the previous lecture style talk.  This way any skills are reinforced AND the members with more questions can ask the lecturer something specific.
results.name: Developer Unicorns

Stampingly,

results.description:
We're a group of people who use self observation an anthropomorphism to improve any part of our lives.  It should be also fun and easy! We gather in Manhattan for workshops or meetings in the park or other interesting venues. 

A big part of what we explore are the relationships we have with the different topics in our lives. That's why we use anthropomorphism! Tapping into - and using - this cognitive process leads to more influence, understanding and happiness in our lives.



The I Philosophy:

'Talking to yourself' That's sound weird right? But we do talk to ourselves all the time. We've got these little voices in our heads like in the new Pixar movie 'Inside out (trailer)'.


Why we are a big fan of this movie?

Every sensation we experience; thoughts, feelings etc. are all a vital parts of the system that we are. Seeing ourselves as a running system is the answer to improve our lives. For example it is great to see in the movie that Sadness and Anger are as important as Joy for the whole happiness of the main character..! This totally corresponds with the I Philosophy.

Eva Helmond developed this pragmatic, easy and fun method to explore the relationship with certain topics in your life in 2013. She moved from Amsterdam to NY where I Philosophy is a big success.

Walk & talks (workshops while walking): they begin again in April in Central Park
results.name: I philosophy NYC

results.description:
This group promises to be more active and diverse than the typical expat meetup group.

While we'll also have the ubiquitous expat pub gathering, ours will happen more than once every three months. More importantly, we'll have more than just pub nights. And most importantly, everyone is welcome. Canadian or not. But be warned: chances are that you'll be outnumbered by Kannucks!

On variety and frequency... We already have two weekly events posted on our schedule and have had great turnouts so far.

Join us for Tuesday Night Street Hockey!

Or come on out for Thursday Night Crokinole! If you don't know Crokinole, it's a mid-1800s Canadian table-top game, which is perhaps most similar to shuffleboard. It's easy to pick up and well social.

In the near future, you should also expect the following such things from this group:

• Outings to NHL games, to the Catskills for snowshoeing, and to NYC Beer Week.

• Opportunities to play soccer with (and against) other Canadians in charity tournaments and leagues.

• Information about how to get involved in the local community by volunteering with award-winning non-profits - some of which are run by Canadians living in New York.

• Myriad other ways to get involved in local life with like-minded Canadians and non-Canadians.

Join us and jump in this Thursday's Crokinole session! There's perhaps no better way to meet new people than over this classic Canadian fixture.
results.name: The Alternative Canadian Expat Meetup

results.description:
Tri-County Camera Club of New Jersey

We are one of the most active camera clubs in northern New Jersey. Our members join to learn about taking good photographs, to see the work of top photographers and to share their own photographic ideas. Our club has been home to outstanding photography for over 60 years, and has been meeting in Nutley, New Jersey since 1963.

Our goal is to learn and grow as photographers. This is accomplished as members exchange ideas, share experiences and offer technical advice. Outside experts are also brought in to offer workshops and demonstrations.

We are a member of New Jersey Federation of Camera Clubs (NJFCC) and the Photographic Society of America (PSA). As a club, we have successfully participated in competitions held within both organizations and received not only club recognition, but also individual ribbons, medals and trophies.

results.description:
Hello my lovely new friends! Please read the description all the way down, thank you.

I am a new business owner in the Central NJ area and this group is for my fellow new female business owners and/or professionals that are transitioning into entrepreneurship. Mastermind groups offer a combination of brainstorming, education, peer accountability, and support in a group setting to sharpen your business and personal skills. The main purpose of this group is to hold each member accountable to her goals, provide access to information/resources, and support. How may we serve you?

This group is for success-minded ladies who take full responsibility for their lives and are focused on solutions. We are made up of a diverse array of women. We will be small so we can develop a real community and connection.

*This group is not a company, we are not peddling services or products, and our meetings will not serve as a platform to advertise any companies or businesses*.

How it will work - The Roundtable

This group will meet at least once a week. Each lady will take a turn and speak about what she is working on, goals, and with what she needs help. Whenever a person is speaking, everybody else will be respectful and listen to her without judgment. Then for the next 20-30 minutes, the rest of us will brainstorm, share ideas, solutions, and constructive feedback towards a solution for her. Each lady will feel free to share as much or as little as she wants. This will not be a "woe is me" session and every lady will be safe to share herself without fear of being attacked or made to feel ridiculous.

Kindness above all else is our most valued principle.

After the meeting is over, we can leave, or just chat and get to know each other. Come prepared to laugh, form friendships, and have intelligent discussions with other incredible females.﻿

results.description:
NATURAL WAY OF LIVING was established by Irmansyah Effendi, M.Sc. in 2014 as a company that endeavors to help others to be physically, mentally, emotionally and spiritually healthier by using the physical body more in accordance with the way it was created by The Creator through organizing relevant workshops as well as training centers. 

The pioneering program from NATURAL WAY OF LIVING is the Secrets of Natural Walking™ (SONW) workshop that was officially launched in January 2014 in 3 major cities in Indonesia with more than 500 participants in total.  In an astonishingly short time frame, even before the workshop ends or just a few days afterwards, so many people have experience significant and tangible benefits. Workshop participants who needed surgery for their physical problems were healed. Others experienced better improvement in body shape and natural weight loss compared to routinely going to the gym 3-4x/week. Most people also enjoy feeling more refreshed and energetic in their daily lives.

Why is Secrets of Natural Walking So Effective?

Secrets of Natural Walking (SONW) is a very natural walking therapy, giving various extraordinary benefits for body shape, health and even for our internal organs, thoughts and mood, without any side effects at all. SONW is very beneficial for people of all ages even for seniors. SONW is beneficial for those who both in ill and good health.

We do not walk properly

All of the known benefits from these various researches are only a minor part of the true benefits we can achieve from walking. The true benefits have not yet been achieved because most people still do not walk properly.

What’s the proof? Look at the soles of your shoes, for most people the left and right soles are worn out unequally. Measure the size of your calves. For most people, the shape and size may not be the same because they do not use both sides of their body equally. This is why, what should naturally happen when we take each step cannot happen properly. 

Natural Healing Abilities

Our body is specially designed and created. A grazed skin or a broken bone can naturally mend itself. Our body is equipped with countless natural healing abilities. However,  because the improper way we walk, use our body and improper posture, many of these natural healing abilities are not functioning maximally or even completely stopped.

Our bodies that have the amazing natural healing abilities are also equipped with the most natural way to correct/reactivate these natural healing abilities is the most natural way. Something most humans do everyday.

What is that? WALKING

Beyond a simple step

For those who do not know, eating is just to fill the stomach. On the contrary, our body needs various nutrition from the food that we eat. The same with walking. Every proper step will naturally adjust our legs, muscles, joints, spine, and through the meridians and reflexology zones cleanse all blockages and reactivate the natural healing functions, improving our overall health including our internal organs.
results.name: Secrets of Natural Walking of NYC - Unofficial

results.description:
The Major Meetup Network are leaders/assistant leaders of large meetups. We intend to build a critical mass of large meetups, defined as:

• 1,000 members or more
• Actively running events (at least 3 annually)
• Focused on technology, startups, marketing/media/social media, the future and socializing.
• Initially limited to the NY metro area and later expanding to other metro areas.
• Operating ethically.
• Not political or religious in nature. 


By virtue of our substantial combined membership and ability to segment as above, we can:
• Be more appealing to sponsors and related partners. Sponsors wanting to reach larger numbers than most meetups can provide will be able to justify an investment in our network.
o The same sponsor that wouldn’t find it worthwhile to support a 1,200 member group could be more interested in one with 25,000 or 50,000+.
• More easily co-promote or co-produce events with each other.
• Negotiate more effectively with venues.
• Draw speakers to New York for multiple meetups.
• Share ideas, resources and post inquiries among ourselves.
• Secure member benefits and perks not available to our separate meetups. We will meet periodically to review direction and make connections. 


Join us and benefit from the power of our network. Open to Organizers and Assistant Organizers of Meetups with 1,000 or more members, subject to the sole discretion of this meetup’s organizer.
results.name: Major Meetup Network

Whether your group has futurist in its name or that is an important theme in your events, we welcome your participation.

results.description:
Visualize basketball (or soccer), but played on the river in between downtown Brooklyn and lower Manhattan, in a kayak. 

Now picture this for free!

Brooklyn Kayak Guides–in association with the Brooklyn Bridge Park Boathouse and Conservancy–is setting up kayak polo games on Sunday afternoons. We've got the equipment (kayaks, vests, helmets, paddles), you bring the body, enthusiasm, and sportsmanship (shorts/sandals, too). Your level of experience doesn't matter. Prepare to get addicted. Soon you'll be passing the ball like some aquatic-John Stockton. Do you whitewater? Paddle leisurely? Nothing will improve your kayaking skills as rapidly as playing this game. 

The catch? We're limited to 15 participants per game, so reserve your spot for the game at 11AM. We'll put you in a team and give you a vest number. First-come first-served basis. Dedicated players and volunteers, though, will end up being teachers to others. 

Season begins in early June (June 7th 2015) and goes on for all 12 Sundays, till late August. 

We focus on individual attention and kayak mentoring, and is the best free kayak learning experience you can get in NYC. It's from 11am-12PM. 

• Our Meetup game is 11AM-12PM. Arrive at least 30 minutes before game time to be donned with vest, helmet, paddle, and kayak. 

• We're at Brooklyn Bridge Park, on pier 2. The High St station (A/C line) is closest, and is a nice 20 minute walk to pier 2 (so, to be on time, you should be exiting the station at around 10:10am).

Get ready to have fun.
results.name: Brooklyn Kayak Polo

Hosted at Cabana Grill, a Fun & Friendly Dinner Dance Club.  Cabana Grill is a great place to meet and host our event.  The atmosphere is warm and friendly and the dance floor is open and big for a group of people to enjoy social and partner dancing.  So, if you are someone who would like to get out of the house and have a mid week "pick me up" to get through the rest of the week,  join a FUN GROUP of people who want to mix and mingle with dancing (Even if you don't know how) then this is the group for you.  We will be sure you learn the basics and some fun variations to put to the dance floor.  You don't need to come with a partner, both Singles and Couples are welcome to join.  If you love to dance or want to dance then STEP on down and give it a try!  look forward to seeing you next Wednesday!

Tasogare network seeks to be a gathering place for NYC anime enthusiasts who have great dedication to unabridged details and knowledge. Our main purposes are offline networking and information exchange - major activities are self introduction, group discussion, and presentation. We hope that this will lead to favorable social interactions and more sophisticated appreciation of japanese animation.


Please be aware that following directives will be strictly enforced:

* All media will be played in its original audio, with or without subtitles. No exception.

* Original name order of characters/persons will be preserved. Use UPPERCASE to indicate the surname if needed (ex. Ayanami Rei, AYANAMI Rei)

* Please refrain from cosplaying outside special events. Impress others with your words.

results.description:
**You acknowledge that you'll be an active member of this group by joining.**

I started this husky playtime group for some fun socialization lovers and companions of Siberian Huskies (and mixes). Socializing, husky interaction and etc. We host meet-ups throughout the new york city area almost every weekend. There are a lot of Huskies out there that need social interaction and can't get none such as my husky because they are known to play rough. Siberian huskies have lots of energy, play rough while socialize with other dogs. I'm hoping to bring together a group of husky and husky mixes for regular play dates to

1) run that energy off!

2) let them socialize with dogs their own breed, and temperament.

3) meet regularly enough that they bond with their playmates. Its for socializing, free and fun.

On Weekends, mostly Sunday!

We are now teaming up with Tyler from @nycdogmushers and intergrating dog sledding AKA "dryland mushing" as part of our meetups!

**You are responsible for your dogs' actions and their well being so make it a priority!**

NOTE:  We (group members) are professional guides and do not have certified training or insurance. Be aware, inherent hazards and risks are associated with walking, hiking and all other physical activities. You may participate with us in any activity but you do so at your own risk. You alone are responsible for your own safety and health. The more prepared you are, the better the chance you will remain safe. Your preparedness not only affects your safety but the safety and enjoyment of the whole group.

If you haven't attended a meetup within a year since you've joined you will be removed.

All events held are at you and your dog's own risk.

**I also ask if you choose not to attend an an event, please select not going as an option.**

By joining this group , you are agreeing to indemnify me and any other event host, and hold the event hosts harmless for whatever you, your dogs, your guests, may experience or cause at any of the events. We are merely participating in an activity ourselves and are simply inviting others to join in.

You can sign up as an individual, with a few friends or as an entire team. results.description:
Imagine the pride and satisfaction of living in your own home....especially one that you build  yourself!!!! Don't think you can - many others have thought that exact thought.  

We are creating and educating a community of people who are interested in building their own home and then empower them with the skills to successfully oversee the complete process. 

They are encouraged to share and to coach others through that same journey which cements the lessons they have learned. 

This community helps to remove the fear and uncertainty of the home building process by fostering and sharing of experiences and mistakes with others. 

We are seeking those that are interested in investing the "smart" equity and sweat equity necessary to significantly impact their building process. 

Even those who hadn't yet considered building their own home are encouraged to stop by, listen and keep an open mind to the advantages of this endeavor.

We will be holding regular meetings which allow the face-to-face connections necessary to create the sharing community which can generate ideas and stimulate creative solution thinking.

results.description:
The New York Swift Developers Meetup is part of NY's burgeoning mobile developer community.  

We’ll be presenting new developments in the language and tools, new frameworks, advanced animation techniques for great user interfaces and great new apps. For beginners, we’ll be discussing topics like functional programming, closures, optionals, and how memory management works in Swift. We want to build a great community that give support to developers as they learn the modern (and beautiful) new language that Apple has designed and created.

Hosts:
Aditya Narayan, is Co-Founder of Turn to Tech after having been Chief Architect at Marvel Entertainment & Head of Security Architecture at Starwood Hotels along with an Architect role at JP Morgan Chase. He holds an MS&BS in Physics from the Indian Institute of Technology. He also founded 1to1Tutor, a successful online Math company which has tutored over 25,000 students. Prior to that he created ‘InterStructures’ - the popular Windows-Linux interoperability platform and has various technology publications.

Michael Prenez-Isbell. Michael just left Conde Nast after 3 years as Manager for Mobile, working with brands like Vogue, Vanity Fair and The New Yorker, and hosted the New York iOS Developer’s Meetup quarterly in the Conde Nast auditorium.
results.name: New York Swift Developers

results.description:
This is a Meetup for musicians and non-musicians alike who want to explore everything alt/indie/B-side in (mostly) music through playing acoustic music, attending live shows (including music-related films), and discussing books. Live performances/concerts will include folk, rock, pop, jazz, classical, world - as long as it's alt/indie/or B-side.  (See clarification below about the monthly jam.)

Monthly "B-Side" Acoustic Music Workshop: Each month, we will meet in a small group of up to about 14, divide into smaller groups of twos or threes to work on a songs collaboratively and then to perform them for the groups that same evening. They can be originals or covers, but We're aiming to play alternative/indie style music OR do alternative/indie/unique versions of classics. 

Clarification: 

Some people may be confused by the alt/indie/b-side thing.  To put it another way, it simply means bring something different!  While the emphasis is for more current alternative or indie singer songwriters/bands, b-side means we should also consider lesser known tracks from people/bands we all know and lover.  For example, here's a link to some not-often-played/covered Eagles songs    

http://ultimateclassicrock.com/most-underrated-eagles-songs/

Live Music/Arts Outings:  Ever want to attend go see a band like Belle & Sebastian, or the xx, Wilco - or maybe a cool film or art show? No problem! Each month, we will also offer up live music, art, or film outings. And if you want to add something to the calendar, all you need to do is e-mail me with the show you want to go and I will make you an assistant organizer or host for that show! We will try and mostly do venues that are not assigned seats so that we can hang out/talk before or during show. 

Bi-monthly Book Club: we will choose a music or arts related book and meet at various fun locations to read and discuss. Suggestions welcome!
results.name: Fairfield/Westchester Indie Music Jam & Events

results.description:
We are a group of Christian believers who have come to the Bronx from rural Pennsylvania. We have two families who recently have moved into the city to share our love with the people here. We originated as a result of day trips into the city for a number of years to share the light of the gospel. As we made acquaintances here, they requested a church where we could meet together. We started out as a one Sunday a month Bible study and as more interest grew we became a local body of believers with church services every Sunday and some services in the week. In June of 2014 we moved a pastor into the Bronx. Our congregation consists of the two families here, two families and some youth who drive in from Pennsylvania, and a number of dedicated people from the city. A personal note from the pastor:
Hi there! I am Tim. I was born in 1976. My brother (my co-pastor) and I are in the middle of six children. Today of those six, two are missionaries in Honduras, two of us are involved in the church plant here in the Bronx, and two are settled in Pennsylvania. My wife and I are known in the community here in South Bronx as the family with the 5 boys. That recently changed when boy number 6 joined the family. If you see our crew in the park or the store, be sure to stop us and say hello. We would love to make the acquaintance.

results.description:
"Learning to program in an unstructured structured environment..."

Online learning has taken profound leaps forward with institutions from Amazon to Stanford University offering FREE online courses. The variety and scope of courses cover a wide range of material, but there is one constant-- you and I, the lone learners. This is especially true of course work from Universities, where we are learning in unstructured structured environments. 

From working on great sites like codecademy.com, learnpythonthehardway.org, udacity.com and having been a course instructor myself, I can speak directly to main component that’s missing: A peer review group. A real social network that drives us forward as E-Learners.

The goal of our meetup is to fill this void.  Members of our meetup will work with each other on course material at our meetups--collaborating conceptually on processes and ideas vs. giving out answers since that defeats the whole learning thing.

If you have a passion for learning and an affinity for technology join us today!

Krishna
results.name: iOS/Android E-Learning & Programming Peer Review

results.description:
Five people with ideas about shaping the future of their profession organized their thoughts and their peers to form the Grant Professionals Association. GPA is the first organization focused solely on the advancement of grantsmanship as a profession and the support of its practitioners. (Read our Mission Statement)

Since its inception in 1998, GPA has grown rapidly. With over 1,800 current members internationally, the opportunities and benefits of membership continue to attract people from all over the globe. In the spring of 2004, Birmingham, Alabama became the first city to form a local chapter. In the year following, additional chapters were formed. The process of local involvement and self determination is an important benefit of membership.

Member participation in national conferences held annually across the country has provided the practical fabric of a rapidly growing network of diverse grant professionals. Each year, GPA's conference provide timely and informative workshops, round-table discussions, member receptions, funder panels, vendor exhibits and the popular individual proposal review sessions are all available to registered attendees. Additionally, the opportunity to network with peers from around the globe, listen to the keynote address, and participate in the annual membership meetings ensure that possibilities abound at this exciting event.

Fostering a constant critical eye on the current state of the craft, the GPA Journal (published annually) provides a forum for book and article reviews, discussions on best practices, and scholarly examination of the state of the profession. The member’s electronic forum provides another venue for the exchange of ideas, issues, methodologies and other relevant discourse on a member-to-member basis.

For the long term, GPA continues to lead the efforts to establish a formal credentialing process. Grant Professional Certification Institute (GPCI) was formed as an affiliate organization to GPA for the purpose of overseeing the development of critical standards within an ethical framework that will help define the future of grantsmanship.
results.name: (GPA) Grant Professionals Association NJ Chapter

results.description: Welcome to the Pepperdata Meetup group! Meetings will be held in NYC on a regular basis. Pepperdata delivers predictability, increasing performance, and visibility for business-critical Hadoop jobs on existing clusters running multiple applications. Pepperdata's software makes every Hadoop node more efficient, allowing companies to run more jobs on the existing infrastructure. Pepperdata was founded in 2012 by Sean Suchter and Chad Carson, former Yahoo executives whose groups were the first two users of Hadoop in production even before it was called Hadoop. More @pepperdata or http://www.pepperdata.com­.

results.description: CircleSinging NYC is a monthly Vocal Improv jam session, a community of singers and music lovers, a really fun way to spend an evening. We get together on the 3rd Wednesday of every month from 7 - 9pm and sing music that's made up on the spot. It can sound like Jazz, Gospel, Classical, R&B, Rock, Doo Wop, Gregorian Chant, African, Tuvan, Tibetan, Middle Eastern, you name it. An instant vocal ensemble with solos. CircleSinging is a form of facilitated Vocal Improv which could be described as “a drum circle for singers” or “improvised choral music.” During the course of the ever-changing chant, the leader develops and gives parts to a circle of singers, which in turn supports individual solos. Both participating in and witnessing the creation of the music that emerges is an exhilarating and joyful experience.

topics.name: How to Maintain your Natural Hair in Winter Time
Keeping a Professional Image with Natural Hair

results.description:
Kinky, curly, coiled, natural hair meetup is a group created for naturals who want to learn how to care for they hair naturally. We will learn how to use natural, chemical free, safe, healthy products to promote hair growth, strength and healing.

We will also try to promote your company, business or event providing it relates to natural haircare and or NATURAL, safe and chemical free hair care products. Please inbox me if you have any questions about it.

You can also join our Facebook groups here------>

100% NATURAL (Relaxer free)

Natural Hair and Skin care Therapy with Essential Oil

Anyone who is intersted in natural solutions would be so welcomed


My Story

When I decided to go natural 4 years ago, it was not because I hated relaxers or because I wanted to get back to my natural roots. It was one of the steps to a total and significant overhaul of my life. I decided to take greater responsibility for my body, soul, and mind. I was very conflicted in my heart; I liked my relaxed hair, but I realized that the chemicals in the relaxers were not good for the health issues I had. Since I did not know what direction to take, I spent one week praying and journaling my prayers, thoughts, and any answers that God had given me. After a week, the answer was obvious; I needed to change my hair care routine. There were three steps I took to turn things around.

The first step of my natural hair journey was to educate myself on natural African textured hair. I had a relaxer for 25 years of my then 36 years of life, so I had no idea how to even take care of my REAL TEXTURED hair. I followed natural hair blogs, watched natural hair YouTube videos, and read books and articles.

The next step was to stop relaxing my hair. At first this was easy, but one year into it and I was rocking an Erykah Badu African wrap-up EVERYDAY!! My wash routine (which started the night before) would sometimes take over 3 hours and consisted of pre-shampooing, washing, deep conditioning, washing, moisturizing, sealing, and protective styling. This took a lot of time and gallons of water. I had to stop swimming, water aerobics and doing serious cardio in the gym because the so-called natural products would run down my face and burn my eyes.

Last step I took was to I made 14 satin pillow cases and sleep bonnets. You all know us beautiful colored girls HAVE to tie our hair up at night with satin scarves or hair bonnets, sleep on satin pillow cases and wear satin scarves in the winter to protect our edges and keep moisture in. Well, you also know that satin hair bonnets, don’t always stay on our heads at night, so sometimes I’d wake up with product on my face.

HAIR PRODUCTS were the hardest thing ever. I spent lots of money and had various brands of so-called natural products. At first it would work and then it would stop, as if my hair was saying, “Yo, chick, I’m over this! Next!” I battled with lots of end knots, dryness, and split ends. My hair was growing but I could never leave it out because it would dry up so fast. I would have to saturate my hair over and over again with moisturizers. My biggest concern at that point was that it would eventually seep down my face and into my eyes. I hated that, so I did some more research on products I could use. Last year, I finally decided to go “Do-It-Yourself” for my hair. I was basically DIY for almost everything except my makeup (which is my 2015 goal)! I was a bit nervous, but with God’s help, I found amazing recipes and ingredients to use.

This opened up a new world of hair care products to me. I felt more in control and I felt confident. I controlled what I used in my hair because I made it. This was so exciting, and I made many different combinations of things. My motto was that I should be able to ingest anything I put on my skin and in my hair. My hair products consisted a combination of Young Living Essential Oils (Lavender, Rosemary, Lemon, Geranium, Cedar wood, Thyme, and Clary sage) with organic carrier oils (Almond Oil, Avocado Oil, Cocoa Butter, Coconut Oil, Grape-seed Oil, Jojoba oil, Olive oil and Shea Butter). In addition, I used Vegetable Glycerin and Aloe Vera gel for moisturizers and Dr Bronners’ unscented soap to create my own shampoo solutions.  These products worked wonders on my hair and skin, along with cutting down my wash routine drastically. 

I can now go swimming, do water aerobics and hard cardio in the gym wihtout worrying about products dripping from my hair. Also, whenever my hair bonnet would come off at night I rest assured that the products in my hair are also good for my face too. HOLLA!!  (Vegetable Glycerin is pretty sweet). It took several months of trial and error, but I am now able to confidently write and say that my hair has flourished under these products, and I myself have become healthier for it.

topics.name: Physical and Emotional Balance with Essential Oil

results.description:
The next time that you drive past a field of fresh lavender or hike through a pine forest, breathe deeply – you’re experiencing the soul-soothing power of essential oils. But essential oils are more than nice scents; these powerful plant extracts are your path to the natural radiance that we are committed to helping you discover. 

This meetup is for anyone wanting to experience, learn and share about the natural healing properties of 100% pure essential oils. 

All workshops and information sessions are designed to have you come away learning something new about the use of essential oils to benefit your health and well-being. 

We will only be sharing about Young Living 100% pure therapeutic grade essential oils, essential oil blends and essential oil-infused products. 


ABOUT THIS GROUP

This  group is for individuals wanting to learn about essential oils and the amazing health benefits of using them. This event will spend time looking at everyday over the counter products and the chemicals and toxins in those products, then learn how we can use our oils to make better products for our families.

This group is about essential oils, which means to get the most out of this Meetup community, you need OILS. As the organizer, I want to serve this group with the best  information I can, so I  make this point. 

You, as a member you  can participate in our essential oils classes using any oil you are comfortable with. But I would be careless in not warning you to make sure that you do your research, and buy the best, therapeutic  grade oil. 

In our classes, when I speak about essential oils and its health benefits, I am  speaking of Young Living Essential Oils exclusively. I cannot speak of any other brand because I do not personally use them, and I do not know the product. 

In this FREE, 90-minute workshop we explore:

How and why oils work 

Modern Medicine vs. Natural Medicine 

Essential Oil Quality 

What are the varied uses of essential oils? 

How can essential oils support your current health challenges? 

How to incorporate oils into your everyday life for optimal health




WHAT ARE ESSENTIAL OILS


Essential Oils are natural aromatic compounds found in the seeds, bark, stems, roots, flowers and other parts of plants. They have been used throughout history in many cultures for their medicinal and therapeutic benefits. 

Dr. David Stewart, Ph.D., D.N.M. Integrated Aromatic Science Practitioner, describes the function of these fragrant essential oils in his book, The Chemistry of Essential Oils Made Simple: God’s Love Manifest in Molecules.

Essential oils have been called “the life blood of a plant.” They circulate through plant tissues and pass through cell walls, carrying nutrition into cells and carrying waste products out. [Page 59]

When essential oils are applied to people, they do the same thing, carrying oxygen into cells and carrying waste products out. In fact, essential oils are one of nature’s best body cleansers. They can cleanse our cellular receptor sites of pharmaceutical drugs, petrochemicals, and other disruptors of intercellular communication. They can also chelate heavy metals and other toxins, helping to remove and flush them through the liver, colon, sweat, lungs, and kidneys. They can also increase our ability to absorb vitamins and other nutrients. [Page 59]

Why I use Essential Oils

Essential oils have also been used for thousands of years for cosmetic purposes, as well as for their spiritually and emotionally uplifting properties. Young Living has always been at the forefront of bringing this ancient tradition to modern users, introducing millions to a total mind body wellness they may never have dreamed possible. Primarily extracted through careful steam distillation but also through cold pressing, the purest essential oils are far more powerful than the botanicals from which they were extracted. Any time you hold a bottle of our powerful essential oils, you are holding nature's pure essence. Any time you hold a bottle of our powerful essential oils, you are holding the pure essence of health-promoting botanicals that can be diffused, inhaled, applied topically, incorporated into massage, or taken internally to:

 Inspire a positive emotional state: Each essential oil’s complex, pleasant, and unique scent activates the limbic system—the brain’s center of emotion and memory—differently. Essential oils can be your key to a more fulfilling and balanced emotional life.

Essential oils are convenient, quick and easy to use.You can wear them during the day, diffuse them in your home or work place, or simply keep them in your pocket. Essential oils can be used in massage, and to enhance meditation and concentration.

Essential oils  penetrate the skin and cell membranes.They can actually diffuse throughout the blood and tissues instantly in a matter of seconds! Oils cross the brain-blood barrier and reach the amygdala and other limbic parts of the brain that control our mood, emotions and beliefs. So they can help us with our ability to handle stress, anger or any other emotion we are dealing with! 

Enhance your physical wellness :Modern lifestyles don’t always create optimal conditions for physical wellness. Poor diet, lack of exercise, and an overabundance of environmental toxins can leave the body unbalanced and diminish energy levels. From cleansing and weight management to supporting every system of the body, essential oils and essential oil-infused supplements can provide the targeted solutions you need to restore balance and feel your best. 

Essential oil benefits include oxygenating properties.Because they contain oxygen molecules they can transport nutrients to cells that are nutrient and/or oxygen deprived. Healthy cells need oxygen. 

Essential oil benefits include that they are high in antioxidants. We know that antioxidants strengthen the body’s systems to prevent the damaging effects of aging, diet, and the environment; and eliminate free radicals. The Oxygen Radical Absorbance Capacity (ORAC) which tells you the antioxidant capacity of a food item is documented for many essential oils. Clove essential oil has an ORAC value of 1,078,700 µTE/100g; this is a million more than the value for carrots which is 210 µTE/100g! 

Purify your home: Harsh chemical formulas aren’t your only home cleansing option. Enjoy peace of mind without compromise when you polish countertops, clean sticky messes, and cleanse dirty surfaces with the gentle but effective power of essential oils,

Refine your skin: Purge chemicals from your beauty routine and rediscover your natural glow. An ancient skin care secret, essential oils can help promote a clear-looking complexion, soften the appearance of signs of aging, and nurture healthy-looking hair. 

Essential oils soothe muscles and joints. They also can assist with minor aches and pains related to everyday activities especially in combination with massage. Yeah!  

Essential oil soothe digestion. Peppermint (Mentha piperita)is one of the oldest and most highly regarded herbs for soothing digestion, it may also restore digestive efficiency.  

Essential oil benefits include d-limonene a powerful antioxidant Lemon consists of 68 percent dlimonene. 

Create deep spiritual awareness: Incense and essential oils from plants have always played an important part in religious and spiritual ceremonies, helping participants to transcend the trivial and connect with something larger than themselves. Research shows that the pure constituents in these oils stimulate olfactory receptors and activate regions in the brain’s limbic system associated with memory, emotion, and state of mind. To enhance your spiritual practice, dilute and apply meditative, empowering essential oils directly to wrists, feet, and behind the ears, or diffuse in a quiet space.

Why I chose Young Living Essential Oils

Young Living is proud to set the standard for essential oil purity and authenticity by carefully monitoring the production of our oils through our unique Seed to Seal® process. From the time the seed is sourced until the oil is sealed in the bottle, we apply the most rigorous quality controls possible to ensure that you are receiving essential oils exactly the way nature intended.

Our exclusive Seed to Seal process includes five painstaking steps:

Seed -Potent essential oils come from plant species that have been authenticated by Young Living experts. Species certification involves scientific research, field study, university partnerships, and on-site planting certification.

https://vimeo.com/97942386

Cultivate – Through cultivation on the four Young Living farms, Young Living Essential Oils has mastered the creation of pure, potent essential oils. The company takes this knowledge around the world to co-op farms to certify that these farms’ growing processes meet Young Living’s strict quality standards.

https://vimeo.com/98075123

Distill – Young Living’s proprietary low-temperature, low-pressure steam distillation process ensures that the beneficial plant compounds in every batch of essential oil remain uncompromised during the extraction process.

https://vimeo.com/97562865

Test – Each essential oil must pass Young Living’s stringent testing to ensure the optimal bioactive natural compounds are present. Young Living uses its own internal labs, in addition to third-party audits, to verify that international purity and potency standards are met and surpassed.

https://vimeo.com/97562866

Seal – Young Living completes the Seed to Seal process by carefully sealing each bottle of essential oil before shipping them to members worldwide.

https://vimeo.com/97942388

results.description:
ABOUT US: 
The North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club, an outdoor recreation and conservation group founded in 1922 in New York City, sponsors hikes of different levels and other events on weekends and Thursdays throughout the year. Hike destinations in the scenic and historic Hudson Highlands region of New York and New Jersey include Sterling Forest, Ramapo Reservation, Harriman-Bear Mountain State Park, Jockey Hollow, and the West/East Hudson trails. Special outings may involve trips to other destinations, such as the Catskills and Adirondack Mountains.  

A full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes and announcements are also posted on our Facebook page.

MEMBERS: 
Members are a diverse group of men and women of all ages, families and outdoor enthusiasts, those interested in a workout, and people who want to enjoy beautiful vistas in good company.  After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the Adirondack Mountain Club (ADK) to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities. 

Membership comes with a variety of benefits including, among other things:  a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region. To join as a member, visit the ADK website. 

OUR HIKES:
New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance.

   Pace Ratings: 
      A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster
      B = Moderate - about 2 mph
      C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

   Distance: Noted in miles

   Terrain Ratings: 
      A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, possible rock scrambling
      B = Moderate climbs and descents
      C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing (moisture wicking, extra layers, no jeans/sneakers) and bring the proper gear (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials), food and at least two liters of water. 

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

If you have any questions about our hikes or other North Jersey Ramapo chapter activities, please send us an e-mail at info@hudsonhikers.org or post on our message board.

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

     Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots. Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

     Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

     Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

     Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike.  For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

     Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

     Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

     Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.
results.name: Adirondack Mountain Club - NJR Chapter

Beginners Conversation – Thursday evenings 7:00 – 8:30 PM

Meets in private homes in Livingston, New Jersey

This group is for beginning Spanish students who have had at least a few classes and would like to practice what they have learned. We select a topic and engage in conversation, as well as vocabulary and grammar activities related to that topic. At times we use a text. There is a $10 fee per class, which goes to the professional services of the teacher, as well as to Meetup fees.

Intermediate Conversation – Monday evenings, 7:00 – 8:30 PM

Meets in restaurant on border of Livingston and Roseland, New Jersey

This group is for intermediate to advanced students who feel comfortable in holding a basic conversation, and have studied various verb tenses and intermediate vocabulary. At these meetings/classes, we converse entirely in Spanish, and read and discuss articles in Spanish. There is a $10 fee per class, which goes to the professional services of the teacher, as well as to Meetup fees. Note: this fee does not include any food that you purchase at the restaurant.

We encourage active participation:

Our Meetup encourages active participation and occasionally removes inactive members. Members are considered inactive if they have not attended a meeting in three months or more. Exceptions are made if a member explains his or her circumstances and expresses the desire to join us in the near future.

If at any time your situation changes and you wish to rejoin the group, we will welcome you back! Please feel free to contact me with any questions at pfressidrobo@hotmail.com

results.description:
Founder Eric Weisberg's Mission:

This group is geared towards younger (20s and 30s) people who are looking to try new cuisines, restaurants, and share in interesting conversations and make some new friends.

So far (as of mid-August) the median all in price for a meal with the group has been around $35, with meals ranging from $16 to $300.

My goal with the group is to combine the best elements of many different food groups I have been to. Here is what sets this group apart:

1). We will typically have 1-3 meals per week. Some weeks will have more and some will have less. So far we have averaged around 2 per week.

2). I am aiming to organize smaller dinners so everyone can get to know each other and we avoid being a large and awkward group. Dinners will almost always be around 4-5 people. This makes it very important that you show up if you RSVP. So far I have been asking new members for a written confirmation of attendance and we have had 100% attendance. I hope this will continue.

3). Fees: I hate it when meetups charge a few dollars from each member. It makes me feel like the organizer is making money instead of bringing people together to enjoy an activity. I will cover all the meetup fees for now. If anyone wants to contribute feel free to but for now I am not going to ask.

4). A lot of groups seem to do the same activities or go to the same places over and over again. I will find new and exciting places to try that have good write ups and reviews. That being said, I am always open to member suggestions, so please send me suggestions of places you want to go.

Thanks and I hope you join the group and we can have a lot of fun exploring the amazing NYC food scene. Please feel free to reach out with any questions.
results.name: Young Foodies (20s and 30s)

results.description:
-- This workshop is open to directors of all experience levels.--

During the Directors Access Workshop, Jeremy Wechter will teach you how to evoke powerful performances to tell the story you envision. While learning Jeremy’s six point ACCESS method, you will have the opportunity to practice the ACCESS method by directing actors in short movie scene rehearsals during each class. 

Jeremy will coach you through these rehearsals to help guide you to your vision. You will have the opportunity to observe your fellow directors working with the same scene and actors during each class in order to witness how much a director’s input can radically change any scene for better or worse. And by the final class, you will select a movie scene of your choice and direct that scene rehearsal in class to implement what you have learned.

Directors Access Workshop is a fun and safe place to explore your craft of directing actors while expanding your director’s tool box and skill set. When a scene is not working, directors often make a misdiagnosis of where the problem emanates. This workshop is a great opportunity to discover how to correct that common mistake by learning all six points of Jeremy’s ACCESS method. During the workshop you’ll learn to diagnose a performance problem accurately, so the correct method of adjustment can be implemented. This workshop is open to directors of all experience levels.

Pictured above: Jeremy Wechter leading a Directors Access Workshop


Director Rotation: Each workshop will have one movie scene & two actors. Participants will each have a chance to direct one after the other.  This format allows us to see how the scene changes based on the notes each director gives the actors.


Judith Weston -- "Concentrating on the lines - on delivering them the "right" way - makes a performance stiff, rehearsed-looking.  Concentration on an imaginative task, such as a verb, facts or image, takes the actor off the lines and into a created reality."
results.name: Directors Access Workshop
